An error occurred. The API may be down for maintenance… Or someone doesn\'t have Internet…
The server is on holidays at the Phi Phi islands. The response I got was not expected. Please try again later.
Ant mobile can look up for any entity, provided it exists in the information system. Some examples of querys are "I123", "Nicky Minaj", …
General search. ANT decides what is more relevant for the provided query
University staff. Including teachers, researchers and external collaborators (among others)
Student search. This may include, for instance, former students.
Rooms, laboratories and auditoriums, with or without computers or lab equipment
This query must not be empty
There is no menu for this restaurant…
Universidade do Porto in the news
Search for curricular units along with their planning
Search for a specific course and get an overview on the available plan, and curricular units.

Ant Mobile was developed by two devoted programmers looking for a better way to search for people and resources in complex information systems.
This app consists of two main blocks: the app itself and ANT, the platform that indexes the available information on a daily basis. 

ANT is currently being developed (and tested) at the InfoLab (infolab.fe.up.pt) by José Devezas. It consists of a research platform in the domain of entity oriented search. In this particular case, ANT is focused on the University of Porto's information system. It aims at promoting research in this field by providing a basis for integration with other research fields such as indexing strategies, ranking algorithms and, among others, query suggestion. You can check the latest version at ant.fe.up.pt. 

ANT Mobile is the app itself, developed by me, Ricardo. It started as an idea of solving the particular issue of searching for anything at the University of Porto wherever you are. It resorts to the ANT infrastructure to fetch results and show the end users a mobile friendly interface and interaction. Besides that, it also shows additional (hopefully useful) information about the park occupation and the canteens' menu. 

Our motivation is contagious, and thus we managed to "hire" a designer to provide a better overall experience in the app. Her name is Ana Reis (big thanks to her), and you can check her portfolio at cargocollective.com/RochaReisDesign. 

Should you need to get mor information, feel free to get in touch with us at the InfoLab, room I123.
ANT is an educational platform for research in the domain of search engines. This is a particular case study based on the SIGARRA and the University of Porto Information Systems.
Looking for a classmate? A teacher? A room? You name it, Ant will find it for you! In seconds. Tap each result to get more info on the result or get directed to the official page.
Food. You\'re not the same person when you\'re hungry. Find what\'s the menu around you. Canteens and restaurants have their menus and ANT organizes them for you.
We know, chaotic. You can check if there\'s room for your car right before you leave. Courtesy of the faculty.

We hope ANT will make your academic life a bit easier. Its our main goal. And we want to keep improving. Do you have new ideas? Head over to the room I123 at FEUP with a couple of beers or check ant.fe.up.pt to get involved ;)
